title: Dynamic Queue for Supports
body:
I know there have been tons of issues with assigning the support role in dynamic queue already... but as a support main (of sorts), I've recently noticed a really, really annoying issue with the queue for supports.

For reference, I'm an ADC main now but I used to main support. Those are my two strongest roles, so when I queue for ranked I pref ADC first, Support second. And, lo and behold, I **_always_** get support. I have **_never_** gotten any other role when I put support as my second pref. I realize that it's hard to find supports - which really sucks - but this system is absolutely broken for people who _can _ play support, like me, but would rather play another role (so that we're not absolutely helpless if the rest of the team feeds *ahem*). If someone is preffing another role first, then it's completely unfair that they will never get to play another role just because they're _actually_ willing to play support. Not only is this system unfair, it also discourages people from actually preffing support, which only makes the support shortage worse.

I think this should be a super easy thing to fix: just track how many times a player has played support instead of their first choice role and guarantee first choice after a certain number of games. This is similar to what they already do for people who fill support. Does anyone else have thoughts on this?

replies.body:
Riot just needs to realize nobody wants to be forced to play a role they do not want just to play at all.

This is another thing that is destroying bronze/silver/gold ranked, half the players have no idea how to play the champs they are being forced to use.

I have been in premades with friends where one queues mid/sup, the other queues sup/mid, and both get their secondary role. I have to assume this is a bug, because riot cannot possibly employ programmers that awful.
not the only i do mid first and support 2nd
